Tim Bale , PROFESSOR OF POLITICS, UNIVERSITY OF SUSSEX It's obviously damaging because Andy Coulson was a very effective media operator so he is losing someone who was incredibly useful to the David Cameron operation. It is also incredibly damaging because it questions Mr David Cameron 's judgement and that for a politician is one of the worst things you can possibly do. Being a politician is all about... picking the right people to do the right job and the decision to appoint Andy Coulson was controversial in the first place and it's clearly a big, big judgement call that David Cameron has got wrong. `` I think Andy Coulson was somebody who could help the Conservative Party... produce a message which was, if you like,` pub ready', which resonated with ordinary people.
